headline: Hot Artichoke Spinach Dip
description: Three cheeses bring their distinctive flavors to this rich, delicious hot artichoke dip!

video.description: Your guests will love this versatile, cheesy warm dip.
video.name: Hot Artichoke Spinach Dip

name: Hot Artichoke Spinach Dip
recipeIngredient: 1 (10 ounce) package frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish.
In a blender or food processor, place artichoke hearts, Romano cheese, Parmesan cheese and garlic . Pulse until chopped, but not ground. Set aside.
In a medium bowl, mix together spinach, heavy cream, sour cream and mozzarella cheese. Stir in artichoke mixture. Spoon into prepared baking dish.
Bake in the preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes, or until cheese is melted and bubbly.

review.reviewBody: Simple to make! I made two batches, I changed the mozzarella ration to 1/2 and 1/2 Italian mix. #1has mozzarella on top and #2 has Italian mix on top. I loved %
New family favorite.
I like to make it for Thanksgiving

Fantastic!!!! My son likes ordering this dip in restaurants so I thought I'd give it a try at home since we've not been eating out much these days. He loved it! Said it was better than the restaurant! I bought marinated, jarred artichoke hearts instead of canned. I think next time I will try using cream cheese in place of the heavy cream. I plan on making this for a Labor Day picnic in a few weeks! Thanks for sharing!!
Oh...and I like extra cheese! Can't possibly make this too cheesy!
This is the perfect Spinach Artichoke Dip. Our family adds a little seasoning salt for a little bit of extra flavor.
This was not my favorite. It lacked flavor and seemed a little dry.
Not as cheesy as I would like.

I used an 8 oz box of softened cream cheese in place of the 1/3 cup heavy cream. I chopped the artichoke hearts in the blender so they wouldn't be too chunky. I also added a little shredded mozzarella on top of the dip before baking. For a large gathering, I'd recommend doubling the recipe. I made it the night before and baked it for about 45 min at 325 degrees for a double batch.
I've been making this recipe for over 10 years, it's requested by family quite often.
I only used 5 oz of spinach and used 8 oz cream cheese instead of heavy cream.next time I will add some cream. It was a little dry, but good.

Good stuff ... 
I cooked and drained fresh spinach.
I would add more cream cheese and/or sour cream next time to give it a little more creamy/make it a little less dense with ingredients.
I substituted plain Greek yogurt for the sour cream.

I make this all the time. I don't bother with the food processor or with mixing things in two different bowls and combining them later. I just put everything in one small casserole dish (9x13 dish seems WAY too big) and stir everything after 10 minutes in the oven. Also, I just use slightly over 1/2 cup of parmesan instead of a mixture of parm and Romano, plus I usually increase the garlic drastically (and add garlic powder). I used to always make pita chips for this, but I've discovered I like it with tortilla chips right out of the bag even more!! Thanks so much for the recipe!

Delicious recipe! I used fresh spinach instead of frozen and added a teensy bit more garlic than called for! It was fabulous! Got some pita chips to go with it, and am saving it for SuperBowl Sunday tomorrow, I did snag a little taste though.
Just like the restaurants and a a fraction of the cost. So good.
Great recipe. I had no room in my oven, so I made it in a large covered skillet, on medium heat, stirring frequently.

Very easy to make I sub the heavy cream with 1% milk. It was great. It does need a kick to it if you like, I might add pepper next time. A keeper. One note I dont own a food processor and used my immersion blender and that worked fine.
Made this for my Stephen Ministry Christmas party and it was a hit!
Great dip.. followed the advice of other reviewers by subing cream cheese for the heavy cream, added a little bit more garlic. Got a lot of compliments..
This was an easy and delishes dip. All the guest couldn't get enough. Save room for the main dish!
Got the most compliments at Thanksgiving. Making it for holiday parties now.
GREAT recipe. Added salt and pepper. Can just mix it all in mixer and pour in baking dish. Have to double recipe for my family!
Very cheesy. easy to make and very good!
Oh my god! That was the best thing I've ever had in my life.

This was every bit as delicious as the previous reviewers said it was. The changes I made were to add some bacon pieces, 4oz of cream cheese and sub Italian 5 cheese blend for all but the mozzarella. I had some fresh spinach I wanted to use up, so I sauteed it with the garlic in a little butter instead of using frozen. Also, I did not bother with the food processor, just chopped up the artichokes and stirred everything together. Topped with chopped tomato after baking. It was easy and we will be making it often. Thanks!
Way too dry, and putting it in a 9x13 baking dish didn't help. Wouldn't make again, too many better versions out there!
Very tasty, but could have been creamier. My changes, 1x8oz. cream cheese , 1/3 cp half & half, and little crushed red pepper.
This was a big hit at our SuperBowl party! I wish I had made more. Next time I might add some cream cheese to up the creaminess factor and boost the flavor.
it was a little watery. I t was just ok not a favorite. My son loved it and took it home.
Good flavor but way too stringy, not sure why, but will make with blanched fresh Spinach next time. Then it will be 5 stars.
The dip was a big hit among both kids and adults at a dinner party
It was to tangy for my liking
Made this for New Year's Eve party - Everyone loved it! I didn't have any sour cream, so just used Hellmann's Mayo. Yummy! Will definitely make a lot more often!
I made this as one of several appetizers for a family Christmas get-together. It was delicious! I did not change anything on the recipe. I will definitely make again.

I made this for my New Year's Eve party. It did come out pretty good but not as cheesey as I would have liked. I did take some of the great suggestions from my fellow reviewers however. I did increase the garlic to one tablespoon and that really gave it some pop. I also added 4 oz. of cream cheese. Next time I will add 8 oz. f cream cheese instead. I also added 1/2 tablespoon lemon juice and about a 1/2 teaspoon of salt too. I look forward to making this again! Thank you Sherri for contributing this great recipe!
It turned out terrible! Will not use this recipe again
I will absolutely make this again Very good and full of flavor!!I was a big hit at the party
I added more garlic and did more cream cheese and less sour cream. Served with "everything" crackers. It was a hit. I used a stone baking pan and it stayed warm for about 30 mins! A big HIT!

I've made this dip at least three times. I follow the recipe to the letter and it always comes out wonderfully. It's a family favorite and I like to make when we all get together for special occasions.
Delicious! Received tons on compliments.

I reduced the serving size from 16 to 8 and my husband and I devoured it in one night. It was actually our dinner! I didn't have heavy cream so I substituted a mixture of regular milk and butter. Since the size was reduced to 8, I used 1/4 cup of milk and about 2 1/2tbsps. of cooled melted butter. Also, I didn't have grated Romano cheese. I substituted that with about 1 1/2 cups of shredded 'pizza' cheese which included shredded moz, provolone and romano! When mixing all the ingredients it appears thick but after cooking it loosens. Cook the stated time (20 to 25 mins.) then top with extra shredded pizza cheese and turn the broiler on high to brown. So so good.
girls are not a big fan of artichokes, but I love it!
Very good, but didn't seem to have quite as much flavor as restaurant tips. Might only need more salt or something simple like that.
served in a warm bread bowl

I made this dish for a work event in the crock pot. Delish! The only thing I needed to do was add salt and pepper for flavor. It did come out thicker than I wanted (I think b/c I left it in the crock pot too long), but with the addition of a little cream, I was able to take the leftovers and stuff them in a chicken breast for another delicious meal.

This is great. I used an 8oz cream cheese in place of creamer, added chopped tomato. Next time I would not put anything in the food processor. Instead chop up the artichokes and mix it all together. I would also recommend topping it with cheese so that I can get golden brown. We are this with croutinis and it was delicious. Looking forward to the leftovers.

I actually haven't made it yet , I will this Saturday night . I just wanted to point out that the video shows cream cheese being used ,there is no heavy cream or sour cream . The cheese used in the video are gruyere and parmigiano. I will update after making the video version

I was looking for a base recipe and this came in very handy. 

I added and changed a lot so I won't add that all here, but fantastic for what I needed. Very versatile. 

My husband came home from work at 230am and ate the entire thing.
needs 1/2 tsp salt and some crushed black pepper and it is the perfect base dip recipe!
Great dip! Only changes I made was adding green chilies and pickled jalape√±o!

This is really good. Everyone loved the garlic (I added extra...1 TBSN). 1 cream cheese block in place of the sour cream. Added a little chicken stock to thin it out. Extra cheese on top...I told someone to help her self to the left overs and she took it all after a Christmas party.

I made this with some modifications and absolutely loved it! I substituted Greek yogurt for sour cream (same amount), used only parmesan and mozzarella, and added a few shakes of nutmeg; all baked in an 8x8 for an extra 5 minutes or so. I garnished it with parsley and long pieces of green onion to make it look like a little swamp so it could be served as "Dagobah Dip" for a Star Wars party! The picture also features a baked tortilla chip shaped like Yoda. This dip is thick and definitely needs a sturdy chip or bread!

This is always a hit! I've had people who don't like spinach &/or artichokes coming back for more. It goes great with pita or tortilla chips. The couple of adjustments I made: added a pinch of nutmeg & an 8oz package of cream cheese.
added red pepper, 1/4 t minced garlic
So easy and so delicious!!! This was a hit with the whole family; the only change I made was to add a little fresh-ground pepper. Thanks so much!!
I chose to leave out the sour cream. Totally delicious!

Perfection! The only change I made was substitute the heavy cream, I used 8oz of cream cheese instead and added some butter. Great flavor. I also added a bit more garlic but that is just a personal preference. This is a crowd pleaser

This dip is excellent! A keeper. I followed the suggestion of using a smaller pan to bake it so I used a round 8 inch round baking pan. I also baked it for a full 30 minutes and kept checking after 20 minutes for golden browning of the edges...it was DELICIOUS! I added a pinch of pepper and a pinch of salt but I think I will add a bit more salt to taste. I did not have minced garlic so I used one medium sized garlic clove and chopped it along with the artichoke and cheeses.
I doubled everything except the artichoke and spinach. Wasn't cheesy or smooth. Will be looking for another recipe.
I followed the recipe exactly and we were extremely disappointed
Great recipe, would not change a thing!

I made this today but did NOT have spinach. I used fresh Kale instead. I approximately used 5 large hand fulls of fresh kale and boiled it for a few minutes; drained and pat dried it for 10 oz. I proceeded with the recipe with a few changes. I added one small can of whole chilies that I pulsed along with step #2. I used Greek plain yogurt instead of sour cream. As a topping I added sprinkles of paprika.
love this recipe easy to make

This recipe is awesome! When I blend the artichokes in my blender it always comes out creamy. Doesn't matter, it is still good. I prefer the seasoned artichokes in oil. I double the recipe for parties and sometimes mix everything together the night before and then bake when ready the next day. Serving it with Pico de Gallo really steps it up a notch.
This dip is always first to go. For a different twist, I added crab. It went first again. Double the recipe for a party.
love this recipe was very easy to follow have done it about three times now my kids love it!
This is the quintessential party dip - great for the holidays, game days and any day. I really like to serve it with Fritos Scoops - they hold lots of dip!
Made for a party and it was all gone!
The flavor was ok, but really needed salt. Also, I feel the cream was a mistake - mine separated out in a watery and cheesy mess. Will keep looking for a good hot spinach dip without cream cheese.
I'm not an artichoke & spinach dip aficionado like some, but we really enjoyed this dip. It was just as good or better when re-heated the next day.
so good. Thank you for a great recipe.
I make this in the crock pot and it comes out much creamier. It takes a long time that way but I like it better. Also I sub the fat free versions of the cheeses and it's still AMAZING.

Awesome 
My family loves it but I changed it a little. 1/4 cup heavy cream 1/3 cup sour cream 1/3 cream cheese.
This is also good if you make a head and freeze it. Made it a week ahead for my husband birthday and was great.
Its sooo yummy!!!!

I followed the recipe and wasn't thrilled with the taste. I refrigerated it, then later decided to try to improve it. I added 4 oz cream cheese, more garlic, more parmesan cheese and a squeeze of lemon, baked it again for 15 minutes and it was much better. The cream cheese really added a lot both in taste and texture. My husband and son both loved it. Next time I think I will add another can of artichokes as there wasn't enough for my liking.

I used a little skim milk with 1/3 cup of cream cheese instead of the heavy cream and I used a little more parmesan and mozzarella instead of the other cheese but it was super good! My whole floor loved it!
Better than Applebee's ;) yummmmmyyy
This was absolutely delish!!! Made it for a work potluck and everyone loved it!
Made this as an appetizer when I had a party. Everyone loved it! I will make this over and over.
Great recipe! Followed it to the letter, had no issues or complaints: tasted great!
This was a great appetizer! Will absolutely do this again.
this was amazing as is, didnt need anything extra except next time ill probably add cayenne to give it some kick.

This recipe is so simple and soooo good! My family loves their spin dip so it's the first thing we order when dining out for our appetizer....well not anymore we will probably be making this weekly! It also makes a large enough amount for entertaining and goes great with the "Perfect Pita Chips" recipe on this site. I followed this recipe except for following suggestions to add just a little chicken broth to make it smooth and creamy which also helps it from getting thick when reheating. Hope you all enjoy this we sure did

I have made this recipe numerous times! I have used it as a sauce on pizza instead of a red sauce, and as a spread on a sandwich for more pizzazzzz. It is very versatile. I do however, change a few things. Replace the frozen 10 oz spinach with roughly 14-16 oz fresh spinach and it seems to make a HUGE difference. I add 2 more teaspoons of minced garlic, and 1 cup more cup of Fresh Parmesean cheese. I have been known to make a batch and freeze it in small portions (pyrex is the best, you can take it from the freezer to the oven or microwave!). Great for last minute events, and wonderful for parties all through the year. I have not ever had a negative comment. I am so very thankful for this great recipe!
Lacked something....
I made this in an 8 inch square baking dish. Best dip ever!!!

I can't tell you how many times I've made this recipe! Every time we go anywhere and need to bring something this is always requested. Presents nicely in a carved out bread boule and every crumb is always gone. 

I do up the garlic and Parmesan amounts for a little extra flavor amid the mild sour cream and mozzerella. Definitely prefer the hot version of spinach/artichoke dip to the cold one.
Excellent recipe. My family loved it at Easter - served as an appetizer. After dinner, they were still going back for more. They took the small amount that was left home with them!

Amazing restaurant style dip. I did make a few small changes. Two 8 oz pkg of cream cheese instead of heavy cream, 14 oz marinated artichoke hearts chopped, two pkg of mozz, romano, parm mix cheese, three teaspoons roasted minced garlic and 12 oz frozen bagged spinach. I made it for my family steak dinner and they loved it so much they requested it to be served as an appetizer for the crawfish boil the next day. This is definetly a keeper.
Easy and delicious.
Instead of heavy cream and sour cream, I used mayo and a package of cream cheese. Also added several dashes of Frank's Red Hot Sauce and a can of crab meat. We both loved it!
I made this for a football game get together. Super yummy and easy to make! I served mine with warm pita bread.

Everyone loved this. I kind of threw everything into the foodprocessor so maybe it was a little over-processed. I used fresh spinach and plain greek yogourt instead of the sour cream/heavy cream. I halved the recipe.
Made this for the first time for Christmas! Everyone loved it! Used a block of cream cheese instead of the sour cream, yummy!! A special request from my dad to make it again!
Very good! I read through some reviews and instead of the cream I added 8 ounces of cream cheese..mmmmm
Very cheesy and delicious. Made a great app before our Thanksgiving dinner! Served with homemade crackers and pita chips.
Amazing! We had people over and they raved about it, it was gone in a flash. I'll definitely be making this again! Thanks!
it needs pepper and salt, i added cayenne pepper and it made it more flavorful.
Great recipe for one of my favorites! I like to eat this dip with pita chips for added crunch and the chips don't break as easy.
